article: How to Use i.e. in a Sentence
intro: The abbreviation “i.e.” stands for the Latin phrase

steps.title: Use this abbreviation in informal documents or as shorthand.
steps.subtitle: You may put “i.e.” in a sentence if you are  or a letter to a friend, an informal piece of writing for a class, or a quick business note. If you are writing a formal business document or an academic paper, consider using “that is” or “in other words” instead.
sub-points: In some cases, using “i.e.” in a , an essay, or an academic paper may be okay. Double check with your instructor to make sure it is appropriate for you to use this abbreviation in a paper or essay.

steps.title: Put "i.e."in the middle of a sentence, never at the beginning or end.
steps.subtitle: The abbreviation “i.e.” should always appear after the first section of the sentence, in the middle, so it is grammatically correct.
sub-points: For example, the sentence, “I.e. he likes super heroes” or the sentence, “He likes super heroes, i.e.” are incorrect. The correct sentence would be, “He likes super heroes, i.e., social misfits who save the world.”
